revised_title: Cochlear Degeneration and Electrical Reactions in Shaker-1 Mice
tldr: Researchers studied the structure, development, and electrical reactions of the internal ear in shaker-1 mice, a type of deaf mouse. They found that cochlear degeneration occurs after birth and is associated with changes in the electrical reactions. The study compared the cochlear changes in shaker-1 mice with those in normal mice and provided insights into the genetic mechanisms behind hearing loss in these animals.
